transportAdvice: Palm Springs has a local bus network that covers key areas, but the city is largely car-dependent and most visitors rent a vehicle to get around comfortably. The downtown strip is walkable, and taxis as well as ride-hail services are generally available, but public transit alone is not sufficient for reaching most attractions.

weather.description: Mild and sunny winter days with cool nights, making it one of the most pleasant months to visit.
Warm and dry with comfortable temperatures ideal for outdoor activities and festivals.
Spring arrives early with warm days and blooming desert wildflowers in the surrounding landscape.
Hot and sunny with very little rain, a popular month for visitors before summer heat sets in.
Temperatures climb significantly and outdoor midday activities become uncomfortable for many visitors.
Intense desert heat dominates with very little relief, best suited for pool-focused stays.
The hottest month of the year with occasional monsoon moisture bringing brief thunderstorms.
Continued extreme heat with some humidity from monsoon patterns and sporadic afternoon storms.
Still very hot but temperatures begin to ease slightly toward the end of the month.
Comfortable and sunny with noticeably cooler conditions, marking the return of peak tourist season.
Pleasantly warm days and cool evenings make this an excellent month for outdoor exploration.
Cool and clear winter weather with crisp nights, popular for holiday visitors seeking desert sunshine.
